text: Blue bottle 33cl, nose is classic and round. Aroma is unfortunately a bit less complex, medium sweet, some acidity, classic fermented rice touch, medium oily texture, some astringent finish, ok but no more. Anyway pleasant.

Odorless. Colorless, save for the faintest yellowish hue, crystal clear. Almost flavorless initially, but notes of spearmint, honey and airplane glue build toward a warm flavorless finish. Drinks like water. No off flavors, but fairly tame. Almost quaffable.
Sampled at Marcs fusion. From notes. Rice. Earthy with a little melon and some anise. Very warming
032715;very rice aroma,pale, clear, light sweetness, light body, licorice, sweet harmonic finish.
Clear as water, and no head. Sweet aroma, notes of laqurice. Flavor is sweet, warming alcohol.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear water like color without head. Aroma is sweet, rice, almonds and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet. Dry finish with warming alcohol. 270315
Bottle. No head. Color is water. Aroma and taste are rice malt, almonds, alcohol and has a nice warming finish.
Bottle. Watery colour. moderate almpond aroma. Average almond flavor. Average moderate finish. Oily palate.
Bottle @ Johns. Pours clear waterlike, light lacing. Aroma of rice, light sweet, alcohol. Flavor is light sweet, rice, little alcohol. Thin body, light oily mouthfeel, light warming alcohol. 270315
Bottle, 12%. Clear as water with no head. Aroma is rice, almond, little melon and a little spicy. Flavour is rice, almond, little lemon, spicy, medium sweet with notes of alcohol.
Overpriced Beer Tasting 2014. Rice, alcohol, some fruity notes. Smooth and easy drinkin, but nothing really memorable either.

0,3L bottle (from Solaris) at the overpriced beer tasting. Pours clear slightly golden without head. Aroma is sweet, rice, some sourness and spicy notes. Flavor is sweet, rice, some fruity notes, alcohol. Overall: its drinkable, but nothing special.

300ml [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Beer Tasting 2014 Thin, slick and easy going. Pleasant and and soft. Looks like sake, tastes like sake, a bit to low on ABV.
300ml bottle @Overpriced Beer Tasting 2014. Clear white color. Some fruity notes in aroma. Yeah rice and fruits in taste. Cant detect alcohol, but Im pretty drunk already.

300ml bottle (the 200e of overpriced shit session)
Slightly fruity aroma, some apple, but a bit thin. Taste-wise, iss even thinner, but given that its 13+% thats quite OK. Thin, but alcohol well hidden. Vote for overpriced: 5/5 but I could have some more with sake.
The aroma of this sake has some rice notes. As I sip, I notice the taste of apple as well. The taste is balanced. The finish is somewhat bitter. Still, this is a rather good sake.

Bottle.  Pours clear with a slightly golden yellow hue to it.  Softly floral, gentle rice, fruit, a touch of melon.  Oily smooth, very light and delicate flavors of rice, a soft warmth.  Not a lot going on flavorwise though.  A touch of acidity on the finish, gentle warming alcohol.  Slight nuttiness.  No off flavors or anything, but not a lot going on either.
In bottle. Pours a clear, slightly yelow colour. Nice nose with vegemite yeast and liquorice. Similar flavours. Warming alcohol linger.
First ever sake..! Thanks cgarvieuk. Clear pour, subtle nose of pineapple, melon, slightly earthy. Hint of rice on the palate, slight zest, slight chemical but goes down pretty smoothly.
bottle at home(chilled) ... absolutly clear ... soft open earth rice nose ... quite rough alcohol ... hint of ethanol ...  light rice

This bottled sake from a restaurant poured no head and left behind a uncarbonated clear colored body. The aroma was mild rice. The smooth mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish with a low alcohol burn. The flavor contained notes of mild alcohol and polished rice. A smooth easy drinking decent sake that I would consider buying again.
Bottle, #456. Clear watery pour. Semi sweet flavor with a strong alcohol presence.  Crisp finish.  Havent had much sake, but this is pretty good.
Pours clear. Aroma is pears, melons, and some rice. Flavor is fruity, with rice and alcohol. Solid.

Sample from a Sake Flight at Fuji Jade Garden, State College, PA. Aroma develops lightly floral asian pear flesh. Pours clear. Flavor is sea-salty, brisk, crisp and tart. White fruit flesh. Bits of seaweed. I cant decide if the crisp, gritty character is pleasing or coarse. Clean cucumber. Bright and glimmering. Interesting.

Pours with a slight yellow tint ...

Non-offensive to the max, this didnt last long in my drinking vessel...

Aromas include some grape, light alcohol, and some melon rind...

has some slight burn, 12% seems right...

Flavours of rice, rind, things like that...

like water down the throat, a dangerously drinkable sake.. pretty good actually but lacks complexity...

330 ml bottle. Grassy, honeydew aroma. Slightly salty. Pretty weak flavor, a touch of koji, a bit of alcohol, very watery. Kind of tastes like vodka, although much less strong. Ive had much better, especially for a 12% sake.

Clear with little or no legs.  The alcohol vapors are there but in check.  The flavor is light white grape, light rice, light sweet melon...followed by light alcohol burn.   This was lightly sweet upfront followed by a very quick and dry finish.

Chilled bottle from Party source. Poured clear with no color and no legs. Light rice and alcohol aroma. Light body with a watery texture. Light sweet flavor with a small alcohol finish of short duration. You get what you pay for.

This was my first sake, and I wasnt sure what to expect. Started out a clear pour, with minimal aroma, except for a hint of rice. Initial sips were some rice and some water, but basically smooth. Deeper into the glass, the 12% alcohol became more and more apparent, until at the end, I felt like I was drinking moonshine,. Thank God there was not a candle on the table, or I think the glass may have blown up. It was pure fuel at the end. Ill probably try a different sake some time, but if this is the norm, Ill pass.
Mild aromas of melon and grass.  Crystal clear.  Very smooth.  Some hints of grassiness and melon again in the taste and a definite note of riciness.  I think this is a very nice sake.

Bottle  Pours just liike every other sake in the world- almost without color.  Resembles semi-dirty dishwater.  Aroma is a pungent white grape with rice vinegar undertones.  Flavor is a starkly brazen rice pudding, with notes of cheap white wine.  Palate is almost forgettable.  Im no sake expert, but I can say Ive had better than this.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Always interesting to sample sakes, as the flavors are just so utterly different from what you find anywhere else.  Clear, a bit thin.  Very faint melon aroma.  Interesting flavors emerged, involving hyacinth flowers, corn husk, and marshmallow.  Not a "clean" flavor like you find in some sake, but the alcohol was noticably utterly absent.  Wouldnt get this again, but happy to have tried it.
Clear...unappealing alcohol aroma...sweet taste with a delicate hint of almonds...finish quick and dry...
